Of these, 3.7 million are from outside the European Union.\n\nImmigration is a hotly contested issue in Italy with national elections a little more than a month away. Far-right leaders have tried to capitalize on national unease about the unregulated waves of migrants who have made the perilous crossing of the Mediterranean in recent years.\n\nLast year, 119,000 migrants arrived by sea. Many others have died during the attempt; at least 90 may have drowned on Friday.", "title": "\u2018Racial Hatred\u2019 Cited After African Immigrants Are Shot in Italy", "authors": []} {"date": "2018-02-28 00:00:00", "text": "Move over, Kim Kardashian. Wreck-It Ralph is heading online. Disney has just released the first teaser trailer for the sequel to the Oscar-nominated 2012 cartoon. John C. Reilly returns as the voice of Ralph, a former video game villain trying to go good, with Sarah Silverman reprising her sidekick, Vanellope von Schweetz.\n\nThis time, the former arcade characters are invading the internet, \u00e0 la \u201cTron,\u201d another Disney property. They learn about new terms like Wi-Fi (which Ralph mispronounces \u201cwifey\u201d) and sites like eBay, where a black velvet painting of a sad kitten is being auctioned off. Even more sadly, they\u2019re also assaulted by the animated equivalent of clickbait, as annoying figures urge them to check out contest offers and listicles about child stars who went to prison.\n\nThere\u2019s no sight nor sound yet of Yesss, a new character (voiced by Taraji P. Henson) who heads up the cutting-edge website Buzztube, but perhaps we\u2019ll see and hear from her when Disney releases a longer trailer closer to the sequel\u2019s release. Last week\u2019s episode was a petulant mess \u2014 blame game champ Thorgy Thor was eliminated, while Milk, the stepchild you meet after the wedding, threw a tantrum over merely being safe. But this week\u2019s contest, with a boisterous main challenge and wig-filled runway, delighted.\n\n\u201cAnother day in the workroom: You get up, you walk in, you step over the body of a dead friend and you just move along,\u201d Trixie Mattel said in a confessional. If only there was a prize for how good Trixie is at confessionals \u2014 oh right, there is: her own show on Viceland. But in competition she recedes, and she knows it. \u201cI never had my star moment,\u201d she told BeBe Zahara Benet later in the episode. \u201cThis time I have to change that.\u201d\n\nSadly she\u2019ll have to wait another week, because this week all flights were rerouted \u2014 to Kennedy. After not quite registering in the first two episodes, Kennedy Davenport leaped to the foreground last night and stayed there the whole episode. In minute one, she disapproved of the penis Thorgy drew on the workroom mirror in parting and clashed with Milk.\n\n\u201cShe\u2019s a clown and you\u2019re not,\u201d Milk said, of Thorgy. \u201cWell, you look like a clown right now.\u201d (I hate to concede anything to Milk, but Kennedy, who\u2019d yet again glued a bunch of mirrorball pieces to her face, looked like a gecko in a diamond mine.)", "title": "\u2018RuPaul\u2019s Drag Race All Stars\u2019: Chi Chi, You\u2019re Worth It", "authors": []} {"date": "2018-02-02 00:00:00", "text": "\u201cDo you think anybody\u2019s going to recognize that?\u201d BenDeLaCreme asked. Milk shrugged this off. (Girl, that was your lifeboat and you didn\u2019t get on it.)\n\nThe \u201cDivas Live\u201d show, choreographed by the peddler of prolonged eye contact Todrick Hall, was a mixed bag. The queens lip-synced to cloyingly impersonated covers of RuPaul\u2019s greatest hits \u2014 you know VH1 can afford 40 seconds of \u201cNasty,\u201d so this move felt particularly cynical \u2014 followed by a \u201cRudemption\u201d runway, where they spruced up disastrous looks from their previous stints on the show.\n\nIn the top were BenDeLaCreme, who rapped cheekily as Julie Andrews; BeBe Zahara Benet, who nailed Diana Ross; and Shangela, who hammed up Mariah Carey and strutted the runway in a giant, rolling bubble. In the bottom: Kennedy Davenport, who lip-synced messily; Thorgy, who, surprise, didn\u2019t quite commit; and, for reasons unclear to me, Chi Chi, who put across a great Patti LaBelle and wore a shapely runway outfit, after repeated criticism from the Season 8 judges for not wearing padding. (\u201cI just loved you in \u2018Eraser,\u2019\u201d Chi Chi gushed to guest judge Vanessa Williams. \u201c\u2018Eraser,\u2019 baby, \u2018Eraser.\u201d\u201d)\n\nDid Thorgy deserve a bottom spot as well? Not really, but the producers were clearly carving a narrative. Milk, on the other hand, was safe somehow, despite a snoozy-glam runway outing and, in the Divas Live challenge, bearing no resemblance whatsoever to Celine Dion. Backstage, she behaved ru-diculously, crying and cursing, while the others rubbernecked in bemused shock. \u201cI was in character the entire time and to not be commended for it, it\u2019s stupid,\u201d Milk said. \u201cI hate this.\u201d (I mean, they know this is going to be on television, right?)\n\nBenDeLaCreme and Shangela were named top two and faced off in a lip-sync to The Pointer Sisters\u2019 \u201cJump (For My Love).\u201d BenDeLaCreme unzipped to a second look mid-song, but Shangela whipped out a jump rope and victory was hers, as was the task of eliminating either Kennedy or Thorgy, who\u2019d continued to grouse backstage and angle for alliances. No dice: Shangela axed her.\n\n\u201cGross,\u201d Thorgy said. \u201cHave a good time without me,\u201d she added in the workroom, packing up. \u201cBye, it\u2019s going to be boring TV.\u201d", "title": "\u2018RuPaul\u2019s Drag Race All Stars\u2019: Dueling Divas", "authors": []} {"date": "2018-02-16 00:00:00", "text": "This week\u2019s episode \u2014 which should\u2019ve included a brief intermission for Adam Rippon\u2019s short program \u2014 featured the beloved Snatch Game challenge, in which the queens impersonate celebrities in a game show battle of wits and laugh grabs. The stakes are high and smarts prevail.\n\nTrixie announced she\u2019d be impersonating RuPaul, to a workroom full of stares. \u201cEvery time I do RuPaul in front of people they think it\u2019s hilarious,\u201d she said. \u201cI\u2019m gonna win the challenge.\u201d\n\n\u201cYou sound real confident, sis,\u201d Aja said, with a hint of friendly warning.\n\n\u201cI am,\u201d Trixie replied, missing it.\n\nThe real RuPaul entered the workroom, with the designer Marc Jacobs, to walk around and instill doubt. (Jacobs, curiously, was not there for a fashion challenge \u2014 perhaps they were getting lunch and Ru was like, \u201cJust a sec, I have to tape this, come with.\u201d)\n\n\u201cYour accent sounded a little like Ireland,\u201d RuPaul told Shangela, who shelved her plans to be Miss Cleo then and there.\n\nDuring the challenge, BenDeLaCreme killed with an inspired, pitch-perfect Paul Lynde, while Kennedy flopped as Phaedra Parks, of \u201cThe Real Housewives of Atlanta.\u201d (Both won Snatch Game in their respective seasons.) Aja did fine as a salty Crystal LaBeija, from the 1968 pageant documentary \u201cThe Queen,\u201d as did BeBe Zahara Benet, as Grace Jones. Shangela wisely opted for Jenifer Lewis, a personal friend she channeled loud and clear. Chi Chi DeVayne, on the other hand, faltered as Maya Angelou, misspelling Ms. Angelou\u2019s name right out of the gate.\n\nThe guest judge Kristin Chenoweth played as well. \u201cI always thought that one of these queens would do me, and no one ever did, so I decided to come here and do me,\u201d Ms. Chenoweth said, singing a high note, something I worry she does in restaurants.\n\nAdvertisement Continue reading the main story\n\n\u201cSweetheart, none of these queens are gonna do ya,\u201d BenDeLaCreme, as Mr. Lynde, quipped.\n\nAnd Trixie started out with a decent RuPaul impression that probably does get laughs in small doses but couldn\u2019t be sustained. \u201cYou\u2019ve won an uncomfortable phone call to your ex and a half-eaten hot dog from the back of my car,\u201d she interjected after another queen\u2019s answer, and Michelle Visage looked on, frozen, like an aunt at the Olympics whose niece just fell on the ice.\n\nNewsletter Sign Up Continue reading the main story Please verify you're not a robot by clicking the box. So was BeBe, luscious in monochromatic dark blossoms. BenDeLaCreme, covered in orchids and shimmering butterflies, was named top two for the fourth week in a row. She was joined by Shangela, done up in a nod to Beyonc\u00e9\u2019s floral-wreathed pregnancy announcement photo.\n\nIn the bottom: the inconsistent Kennedy, who was last week\u2019s winner; Chi Chi, lovely in lilies but adrift in the challenge; and a kaleidoscopically effloresced Trixie, who cried while the camera zoomed in.\n\n\u201cI get nervous here,\u201d she admitted. \u201cIt\u2019s like I\u2019m at Camp Crystal Lake and Jason\u2019s outside with the machete.\u201d\n\n\u201cDon\u2019t forget what you have, and what you offer, and who you are, whether this continues or not,\u201d Ms. Chenoweth said. (\u201cYeah,\u201d the producers of Trixie\u2019s hit Viceland show added, at home.)\n\nBackstage, the top two took meetings. \u201cI\u2019m really proud of you for continuing to plug away at this,\u201d BenDeLaCreme told Chi Chi, sounding a bit like the teacher of that painting class I shouldn\u2019t have taken.\n\nMeanwhile, Aja \u2014 who has calmly consoled so many queens backstage this season \u2014 sat with a vulnerable Trixie. \u201cI\u2019m not afraid of drag in the real world,\u201d Trixie said, and I felt for her. She\u2019s gifted, perhaps just not at \u201cDrag Race.\u201d\n\nShangela, on the other hand, was born for this, holding court in yet another confessional. \u201cThis is the \u2018Game of Thrones\u2019 of drag,\u201d she said, refusing to let an episode go by without making that comparison. \u201cYou\u2019ve got to have alliances. Is Trixie Jon Snow, or is she Cersei Lannister?\u201d (Actually, right now I\u2019d say Trixie\u2019s more Season 3 Edmure Tully, firing arrows at his father\u2019s funeral boat and missing, am I right?)\n\nAdvertisement Continue reading the main story\n\nAfter a lip-sync to Katy Perry\u2019s not-timeless \u201cI Kissed a Girl,\u201d both Shangela and BenDeLaCreme were crowned winners and, in a twist, each was given the chance to eliminate one of the bottom three queens. BenDeLaCreme eliminated Chi Chi, fine, and Shangela, who really did a supermarket sweep of this episode, milked the moment. \u201cThe person I\u2019ve chosen didn\u2019t leave with the crown, but they made a career,\u201d she said, teasing out what sounded like a Trixie elimination, only to reveal she\u2019d eliminated Chi Chi as well. (Warning shot: fired \u2014 and a sobbing Trixie clearly heard it.)\n\n\u201cThank you guys so much!\u201d Chi Chi said, waving. \u201cI\u2019m sad to go, but I think I did the best that I could,\u201d she added backstage, smiling. \u201c\u2018All Stars 3\u2019 was hard.\u201d\n\nFinally: a gracious exit. God, I love Chi Chi. Does she bake? If she can get to the U.K., and get a consistent layer of jam between two Victoria sponges, there\u2019s a show I\u2019d like to see her on.\n\nWill Shangela get played? Will Trixie finally triumph?
